metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9261 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.5-6 Q16, the ReadMNGImage function in coders/png.callows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory leak) via a craftedfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9261` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8').
